Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Okay, lets break this down. The task is to analyze three cases based on the given normative rules and desiderata. First, I need to understand the strict rules and the recommended practices.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Part 1: Normative Process Behavior (Strict Rules) - The process must follow this sequence: Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant [If Approved: Finalize Documentation] Close Case.

Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Part 2: Desiderata (Recommended but Not Strict) - Credit Check within 24 hours of application. Inform Applicant within 48 hours of loan decision. Follow-up Call before closing the case (not strictly required).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 1: Activities are in the correct order: Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision (Approved) Inform Applicant Finalize Documentation Close Case. No steps skipped or out of order. Credit Check within 24 hours. Inform Applicant within 48 hours.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2: Sequence starts with Application Received at 0800, then immediately Risk Assessment at 0820. This violates the rule that Credit Check must occur before Risk Assessment. Then Credit Check at 0900 after Risk Assessment.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Wait, looking back, the log shows that after Loan Decision (Rejected), the next step is Finalize Documentation, which is not allowed, and then Close Case. But the Inform Applicant step is missing entirely!

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Violations in Case 2: 1. Risk Assessment before Credit Check. 2. Missing Inform Applicant step after Loan Decision. 3. Finalize Documentation after rejection.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3: Sequence seems correct: Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision (Approved) Inform Applicant Finalize Documentation Close Case. Credit Check about 61 hours late. Inform Applicant 51 hours after Loan Decision.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Normative Violations: Case 1: None. Case 2: three violations. Case 3: None. Desiderata Violations: Case 1: None. Case 3: timing delays and no Follow-up Call.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Interpretations or justifications: For Case 2: clerical error for order, oversight for missing Inform, system error for Finalize after rejection. For Case 3: workload for delays, overlooked Follow-up.
